result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamekin L Higgs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shamekin L Higgs is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shamekin L Higgs was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 7 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No violent or disorderly contact with Kenisha D. (DOB 09-23-1985).

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
Fine is set at ZERO.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
No drivers license suspension imposed.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shamekin L Higgs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated August 7, 2015 received and filed. tk

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2-
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 7 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- No violent or disorderly contact with Kenisha D. (DOB 09-23-1985).
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- No drivers license suspension imposed.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

AS TO COUNT 1: On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.
AS TO COUNT 2 AMENDED :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing.

Defendant Shamekin L Higgs in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial and motion hearing. Defense counsel withdrew motion to suppress. 
  
Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant wishes to plead not guilty. 
Defendant is charged as follows:
Count 1: Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance (Heroin) contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section; 961.41(1m)(d)2, 939.50(3)(e). Same as previously charged. 
Count 2: Possession of Cocaine, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section; 961.41 (3g)(c), a Misdemeanor.

Court vacated jury trial on 08-10-2015.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated August 5, 2015 Vreceived and filed. tk

Defendant Shamekin L Higgs in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs, who appears by phone.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Filed, JusticePoint Violation Report.  Court admonished defendant stating Judge Stark may set cash bail at next hearing.  Case remains calendared on 8-6-2015 at 1:30 p.m. for final pretrial in Branch 17.
Letter from ADA Hauer received and filed. tk
Notice of Motion to Challenge the Arrest and Suppress Evidence Obtained from the search of the Defendant Shamekins Higgs, with attached cover page, received and filed. tk

Court orders defendant REFERRED to JUSTICE Point for Enhanced Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shamekin L Higgs in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for Motion Hearing. For reasons placed on the record, defense request an adjourned motion hearing. Motion due no later than 7-10-2015 by 5:00 pm. Response due no later than 8-3-2015 by 5:00 pm. Case adjourned for motion hearing and final pretrial on 08-06-2015 at 01:30 pm, branch 17.  Court addresses violation on 06-30-2015.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant, last verbal warning. Any further violation may result in cash bail. Court modifies bail.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 08-10-2015 at 9:00 am, branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 05:00 pm.

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report: Drug Test - Positive, received and filed. tk 
Court will address report.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated June 29, 2015 received and filed. tk

Final Pretrial remains 06-30-2015 at 1:30 pm.
Jury trial on 08-12-2015 at 9:00 am was rescheduled to 08-10-2015 at 09:00 am. 
Parties agree and have been notified.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Vioaltion Report (missed telephone contact) received and filed. Judge will not take any action at this time.
Letter from Attorney Sach received and filed. tk

Defendant Shamekin L Higgs in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs, appeared by phone.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case recalled.  
Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. Court REITERATES that the defendant is to comply with all conditons of bail.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping. Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial and Motion Hearing on 06-30-2015 at 1:30 in Branch 17.

Defendant Shamekin L Higgs in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Off the record discussion placed on the record.   Defense counsel requests case be set for Motion Hearing, Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. State to providedefense all discovery by 06-12-2015. All motions are due by 06-26-2015. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Motion Hearing, Final Pretrial Conference, and Jury Trial, Branch 17.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Calendar call scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 05:00 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 27, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Shamekin L Higgs in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. For reasons presented to the Court, case is adjourned for projected plea and sentencing, Br 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated April 21, 2015 received and filed. tk

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 04/08/2015 received and filed. (18 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Richard Sachs, 1461 E. Goodrich Lane, Fox Point, WI 53217.

Defendant Shamekin L Higgs in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jacob Ivy-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/7/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shamekin L Higgs in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Shamekin L Higgs in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Shamekin L Higgs not in court.  Christopher J Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4-21-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
